text: Jan Willem van Ede (born April 13, 1963 in Utrecht) is a retired Dutch football goalkeeper. ==Playing career== ===Club=== He played the majority of his career for hometown club FC Utrecht and as of 2017, still holds the record of most Eredivisie games played for the club with 409.FC Utrecht.TV: Stage Jan Willem van Ede - FC Utrecht He made his professional debut on 8 September 1982 for Utrecht against PEC Zwolle and won the 1985 KNVB Cup with the club.Bekerwinst Utrecht in 1985 kreeg gestalte bij PSV - NOS He later became reserve goalkeeper at PSV and FC TwenteDoelman van Ede van NAC naar FC Twente - Volkskrant and also played for Haarlem in the Eerste Divisie and NAC. ===Hoekman case=== In 1999, Van Ede was sentenced to pay a compensation after kicking Roda JC winger Danny Hoekman 10 years earlier, which took Hoekman out of the game for almost two years due to a knee injury.Doodschop? - Volkskrant Oud-speler Hoekman heeft na tien jaar strijd eindelijk zicht op schadevergoeding - Trouw ==Coaching career== Van Ede worked as assistant and goalkeeper coach of the Netherlands women from 2005 but was dismissed in summer 2016 due to a difference in view with manager Arjan van der Laan.Wegen coach Jan Willem van Ede en KNVB scheiden - KNVB Next to his job with the Dutch FA, he was appointed coach of amateur side Montfoort in December 2015.Jan Willem van Ede trainer van Montfoort - RTV Utrecht In September 2019 van Ede was appointed the Republic of Ireland Women's team goalkeeping coach, reuniting with manager Vera Pauw. == Statistics == {| class="wikitable" border="1" |----- !
